availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Native of Prussia. Married to Harriet Bijur. Father of Bertha Bijur, William F. Bijur, and Anna Bell Bijur. Practiced in partnership with Byron Bacon and later with Peter B. Muir. Elected as a Republican to the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 5, page 185.
Edwards' Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Institutions, Incorporated Companies, Manufacturing Establishments, Business firms, Etc., Etc., in the City of Louisville, For 1865-6 (Louisville: Edwards, Greenough & Deved, 1866), p. 211.
“Death of Hon. Martin Bijur,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), May 1, 1882, p. 2.
Find A Grave, "Martin Bijur (c1832-c1882)," Memorial #100677226, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=100677226 (accessed June 5, 2017).
